author: The Associated Press
description: Pedro Neto scored in the first half and Enzo Fernández in the 79th minute to give Chelsea a 2-0 win over Los Angeles FC in Group D's Club World Cup opener on Monday.
title: Chelsea beats LAFC 2-0 in their opening match of the Club World Cup

author: The Associated Press
description: A federal jury  Monday found that MyPillow founder Mike Lindell defamed a former employee of Dominion Voting Systems after the 2020 presidential election.
title: Jury finds MyPillow founder defamed a former voting equipment firm employee

author: Alicia Victoria Lozano
description: Utah officials are investigating the role that so-called peacekeepers played in the killing of celebrated fashion designer Arthur Folasa Ah Loo on Saturday at the “No Kings” demonstration in Salt Lake City, police said
title: 'Peacekeepers' under scrutiny in deadly Salt Lake City protest shooting

author: The Associated Press
description: The Louvre, the world’s most visited museum, on Monday was brought to a halt by its own striking staff, who say the institution is crumbling under the weight of mass tourism.
title: Louvre shut down by spontaneous staff strike over 'untenable' working conditions

author: Daniel Arkin
description: This is a free article for Diddy on Trial newsletter subscribers.
title: Diddy trial judge tosses juror as prosecutors lay out more evidence

author: Kate Dore, CFP, CNBC
description: As Senate Republicans release key details of President Donald Trump’s spending package, some provisions, including the federal deduction for state and local taxes, known as SALT, remain in limbo
title: 'SALT' deduction in limbo as Senate Republicans unveil tax plan for Trump's spending package

author: Jonathan Vanian, CNBC
description: It took 11 years since Facebook acquired it for $19 billion, but Meta is finally bringing ads to WhatsApp, marking a major change for an app whose founders shunned advertising
title: Meta is finally bringing ads to WhatsApp

author: David K. Li
description: Legendary competitive eater Joey Chestnut will return to this year's Nathan’s Famous July Fourth hot dog contest, officials said Monday, one year after a sponsorship squabble kept him off the Coney Island stage
title: Hot dog-eating machine Joey Chestnut will return to Fourth of July contest

author: Sahil Kapur
description: The legislation keeps some House provisions, like new Medicaid rules, while making significant changes in other areas, including Medicare and the state and local tax deduction.
title: Senate Republicans release Trump agenda bill text on Medicaid, Medicare and SALT

author: Steve Kopack
description: President Donald Trump signed an agreement Monday formally lowering some tariffs on imports from the United Kingdom as the countries continue working toward a formal trade deal
title: Trump formalizes tariff cuts for U.K. as trade talks continue

author: Nicole Acevedo
description: University of Utah student Caroline Dias Goncalves was briefly pulled over by a sheriff's deputy in Colorado before  immigration agents detained her; now county officials are conducting a review.
title: ICE detains Utah college student after brief traffic stop, raising questions

author: The Associated Press
description: Arkansas’ Gage Wood pitched the third no-hitter in College World Series history and first in 65 years on Monday in the Razorbacks’ 3-0 victory.
title: Arkansas pitcher throws third no-hitter in College World Series history

author: The Politics Desk
description: Welcome to the online version of From the Politics Desk, an evening newsletter that brings you the NBC News Politics team’s latest reporting and analysis from the White House, Capitol Hill and the campaign trail
title: 3 takeaways from the NBC News Decision Desk poll: From the Politics Desk

author: Amelia Lucas, CNBC
description: As Starbucks aims to bring back customers and assuage investors with its turnaround strategy, it is also winning over its store managers with promises to add more seating inside cafes and promote internally
title: Starbucks moves to the next phase in its turnaround: Winning over employees

author: Reuters
description: A federal judge in Boston on Monday said the termination of National Institutes of Health grants for research on diversity-related topics by President Donald Trump's administration was “void and illegal,” and accused the government of discriminating against racial minorities and LGBT people.U.S.
title: Judge deems Trump's cuts to National Institutes of Health illegal

author: Joey Safchick, NBC San Diego
description: In a video captured Thursday, a man calmly tells agents he was an interpreter for the U.S. military in Afghanistan; his attorney said he's seeking asylum and applying for a visa.
title: Video shows ICE detaining man in San Diego who says he helped U.S. in Afghan war

author: Kaitlin Sullivan
description: Proposed Medicaid cuts in the House Republicans’ sprawling domestic policy bill could cause an estimated 7.6 million Americans to lose health insurance.
title: Proposed Medicaid cuts could lead to thousands of deaths, study finds

author: Evan Bush
description: The scientific journal Nature wants to show people the nitty gritty of academic publishing
title: Nature looks to open up 'black box' of science by publishing peer review files

author: Hugh Son, CNBC
description: The long-running rivalry between the country’s top premium credit cards is about to heat up again
title: Luxury credit card rivalry heats up as Amex, JPMorgan tease updates to their premier cards

author: Melissa Chan
description: The man suspected of fatally shooting a Minnesota lawmaker and her husband and wounding another and his wife had “stalked his victims like prey” before opening fire at their homes, elaborately disguised as a law enforcement officer, prosecutors said Monday
title: 'Stuff of nightmares': Prosecutor reveals chilling details of attacks on Minnesota lawmakers

author: Kimmy Yam
description: Arthur Folasa Ah Loo was a former contestant on “Project Runway,” whose designs were beloved by celebrities from “Real Housewives” to “Moana” star Auli’i Cravahlo.
title: Man killed at 'No Kings' protest in Salt Lake City remembered as an acclaimed Polynesian designer

author: Alexander Smith
description: Israel says it first bombed Iran to stop it from being able to produce nuclear weapons and the “existential threat” they would represent.
title: How Israel's Iran strikes might supercharge the global nuclear arms race

description: A juror was dismissed in the trial of Sean "Diddy" Combs over allegedly conflicting answers about where he lives. NBC News' Chloe Melas reports on the possible motivations of the juror and new issues with a another juror.
title: Juror dismissed in Diddy trial amid questions 'about his candor'

author: Ronny Rojas
description: The flow of migrants has dropped significantly, but thousands are still trying to cross, and smugglers are increasingly finding ways to send migrants alone through treacherous terrain.
title: Amid Trump's southern border clampdown,  smugglers and migrants use deadlier routes into U.S.

author: Anna Kaplan, TODAY
description: Justin Bieber shared a message to his followers saying he knows he’s “broken” one day after Father’s Day
title: Justin Bieber shares lengthy Instagram post about 'anger issues'

description: Video shows what appeared to be the moment an Israeli missile hit the Islamic Republic of Iran News Network's studio in Tehran.
title: Watch: Iranian news anchor interrupted after missile hits TV studio

description: Federal authorities say Minnesota shooting suspect Vance Boelter visited the homes of four separate lawmakers on the night he allegedly killed two people and wounded two others. NBC News' Shaquille Brewster reports that investigators are still working to determine his motive.
title: Minnesota shooting suspect went to homes of four lawmakers

author: The Associated Press
description: Malik Tillman scored twice and Diego Luna had a pair of assists in a 5-0 rout of Trinidad and Tobago on Sunday in the Americans' CONCACAF Gold Cup opener.
title: U.S. men's team hopes 5-0 win propels them forward after losing streak

author: Michael Duarte, NBC Los Angeles
description: Known to fans as Nezza, Dominican American singer Vanessa Hernández's Spanish-language rendition on Saturday reverberated around the stadium — and on social media.
title: Singer at Dodger Stadium sings national anthem in Spanish in protest against L.A. immigration raids

author: Sharon Epperson, CNBC
description: Experts say people concerned about being caught up in the immigration crackdown should have a plan in place.
title: Experts on how to protect financial assets amid deportation worries

author: The Associated Press
description: WEST VALLEY CITY, Utah — Three people, including an 8-month-old infant, were fatally shot at a Utah carnival after two groups got into an argument, police said
title: Infant among 3 people fatally shot at Utah carnival after argument

author: Marc Santia, NBC New York
description: Authorities are investigating after two court officers were slashed or stabbed at the Manhattan criminal courthouse Monday, according to two law enforcement sources familiar with the incident
title: 2 court officers stabbed at Manhattan criminal courthouse: Sources

author: Jonathan Dienst
description: Federal officials continue Monday to search for two detainees who went missing from an immigration detention center in New Jersey last week and are offering a reward up to $10,000 for the arrest of each
title: Up to $20K reward offered amid ongoing search for 2 escaped N.J. detainees

author: Adam Reiss
description: The federal judge overseeing Sean "Diddy" Combs' racketeering and sex trafficking trial dismissed one of the jurors Monday morning.
title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs trial judge dismisses juror over 'concerns about his candor'

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: The Supreme Court ordered a lower court to take a second look at a religious challenge to a New York state requirement that employers provide health care plans that include abortion coverage.
title: Supreme Court orders reconsideration of religious objection to N.Y. abortion care requirement

author: Mary Markos
description: An old school building in Boston’s Hyde Park neighborhood, once vacant and “creepy,” is now buzzing with life while teaching new lessons in community and inclusion
title: How a vacant Boston school was transformed into thriving housing for LGBTQ+ seniors

author: Rob Wile
description: President Donald Trump's business organization has announced the creation of a new wireless phone service that will carry the president's name.
title: Trump-branded wireless service launches — with a gold phone

author: Molly Hunter
description: As Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and his fiancée, Lauren Sánchez, prepare for a lavish, star-studded wedding in Venice, not everyone in the Italian city is happy about the impending nuptials."No space for Bezos," a sign read at a protest by residents who say the famed canal city is already overrun by tourists, billionaires, or otherwise
title: 'No space for Bezos': Venetians protest Amazon founder's grandiose wedding plan

description: Watch live coverage as President Trump holds a bilateral meeting with Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney at the G7 summit in Alberta, Canada.
title: Trump meets with Canadian prime minister at G7 summit

description: Ahead of the star-studded nuptials of Amazon billionaire Jeff Bezos and his bride-to-be Lauren Sanchez in Venice, Italy, some local residents are opposing the event, blaming authorities for allowing the city to be overrun by tourists — billionaires or otherwise. NBC’s Molly Hunter reports for TODAY.
title: Jeff Bezos, Lauren Sanchez Face Backlash Over Venice Wedding

author: The Associated Press
description: Shohei Ohtani is going to be the starting pitcher for the Los Angeles Dodgers on Monday night against San Diego, 21 months after the two-way star had elbow surgery.
title: Shohei Ohtani will pitch for the Dodgers after a nearly two-year absence from the mound

description: The president said he expected to reach new trade agreements at the summit.
title: Trump attends G7 summit in Canada amid trade tensions

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: A suspect is in custody in the shootings of two Minnesota lawmakers.
title: Minnesota shooting suspect captured and Trump's support of Israeli strikes: Morning Rundown

description: A juror could be dismissed from the panel today after he allegedly gave conflicting answers about where he lives.
title: Summary witness to testify and a juror could be dismisssed

description: Surveillance video shows the moment an Iranian missile struck a residential building in Petah Tikva, Israel. At least three people were killed in the strike, according to police, bringing the death toll in Israel to 24 since Iran launched its retaliatory strikes.
title: Video shows moment Iranian missile strikes Israeli residential building

author: The Associated Press
description: Flash flooding caused by torrential rains killed five people in northern West Virginia and rescue crews were searching for three other people.
title: Flash flooding kills 5 in West Virginia, rescue teams searching for missing people

author: The Associated Press
description: Britain’s real-life spies have finally caught up with James Bond.
title: Britain's MI6 spy agency gets its first female chief

description: The suspect "gave up peacefully" before his arrest following the largest manhunt in Minnesota's history, authorities say.
title: Minnesota officials to charge suspect in killing of state lawmaker with first-degree murder

author: Courtney Kube
description: President Trump had opposed Israeli action against Iran, but came to believe Israel had reason to act and that the U.S. would have to lend some support.
title: How Trump went from opposing Israel's strikes on Iran to reluctant support

author: Dylan Ebs
description: The vast majority of American adults believe the Trump administration must comply with federal court orders, though the president’s strongest supporters are split over the issue, according to a new NBC News Decision Desk Poll powered by SurveyMonkey.
title: Poll: Americans overwhelmingly want Trump to obey court rulings, but MAGA Republicans are split

author: Ben Kamisar
description: New polling about Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
title: Poll: RFK Jr.'s food agenda finds appeal across partisan lines, but vaccines are a different story

author: Dennis Romero
description: The suspect wanted in the slaying of a Minnesota lawmaker and her husband, as well as in the injury shooting of a state senator and his wife, was found Sunday night armed and crawling in a field in a sparsely populated stretch of Minnesota, authorities said
title: Suspect who terrorized Minnesota's political leaders after deadly shooting found crawling in rural field

description: Vance Boelter, the suspect in the fatal shooting of a Minnesota lawmaker and her husband, as well as the wounding of another lawmaker and his wife, has been captured, Gov. Waltz said in a news conference.
title: Minnesota Gov. Walz announces shooting suspect is arrested

author: The Associated Press
description: The Boston Red Sox traded Rafael Devers to the San Francisco Giants on Sunday in a deal that could shake up pennant races on both coasts.
title: Red Sox trade three-time All-Star Rafael Devers to Giants in blockbuster deal

author: The Associated Press
description: J.J. Spaun turned a sloppy mess of a U.S. Open at wet and nasty Oakmont into a thing of beauty at the end Sunday with two stunning shots that carried him to his first major championship.
title: J.J. Spaun comes out victorious in a rainy U.S. Open
